projects.name: Reciprocating Air Engine
projects.description:
Designed and modeled several components towards the production of a 50cc linkage-driven air-powered engine using SolidWorks, which achieved over 2000 RPM in steady state operation
Manufacturing aluminum, brass and delrin parts using various machining techniques including water jet cutting, milling, and reaming, and other operations

multimedia.caption: Video of one of the air engine speed tests, running a no-load condition. We hit about 2100 RPM here.

projects.name: Deep-Q Reinforcement Learning towards Playing Snake
projects.description:
Developed a multithreaded, highly configurable Python implementation of Snake from scratch
Created and trained a Deep Q-Network reinforcement learning agent to play game using Keras-RL, TensorFlow and OpenAI Gym with near human-level accuracy

multimedia.caption: Poster presented during Engineering Clinic presentations, summarizing the project and research.

projects.name: SolidWorks Flow Sim Car Body CFD Optimization
projects.description:
Designed the exterior of a model car to maximize downforce and minimize aerodynamic drag
Ran studies using the SolidWorks Flow Simulation toolbox to quantify effects of modifications
Incorporated components such as wings, vortex generators, and geometries based on fluid flow theory to achieve a lift-to-drag ratio of -3.5

multimedia.caption: Left column, top-to-bottom: models of iterations 10, 20, and 30. Right column, top-to-bottom: models of iterations 40, 50, and 60.
A front isometric view of the finished stylized car design.
A front view of the car.
A side semi-transparent view of the car and its internals with associated dimensions.

Pressures on the surface of the car from the front isometric viewpoint. Red corresponds to the highest pressures of 14.89 psi and above and blue corresponds to the lowest pressures of 14.16 psi and below.
Pressures on the top surface of the car, using the same high and low pressure values as in the isometric figure.
Pressures on the underbody of the car, using the same high and low pressure values as in the previous figures.

Air velocities along the centerline of the car on the X-Y axis. Red represents the highest air speeds above 301 ft/s (205 mph) and blue represents stagnant air. For clarity, the main body of the car is hidden.
Plot of downforce (negative of lift) in red and drag in blue at various vehicle velocities, according to SolidWorks Flow Simmulation parametric testing.
Plot of drag power at various vehicle velocities.

projects.name: Soft Robotic Snake for RoboSoft Competition
projects.description:
Worked in a team of students across various engineering disciplines to develop a robotic snake capable of traversing an obstacle course including multiple terrains and conditions
Utilized modular design consisting of segments interconnected by motor-actuated wires which propagate contraction and tension of wires to compress springs to create motion

projects.name: 3D Printed and Machined Differential Gearbox
projects.description:
Utilized SolidWorks to model a differential required to handle two inputs of 1000 RPM and produce an output of 500 RPM
Constructed the design out of 3D-printed bevel and spur gears and a machined aluminum housing
Performed static and fatigue analysis of the parts using SolidWorks to determine the failure conditions and factor of safety of the design

multimedia.caption: Slight isometric view of the constructed differential
Top view of the constructed differential
Video presented as part of a project report for the Machine Design course including the gearbox project.
Isometric view of the SOLIDWORKS gearbox model
Top view of the SOLIDWORKS gearbox model

Results of FEA stress analysis with a tangential load of 0.501 kN on a single tooth, which was determined to be the transmitted load given inputs of 1000 W at 1000 rpm and a pitch diameter of 1.5 in (38.1 mm)
SOLIDWORKS exploded drawing of the gearbox assembly
SOLIDWORKS combined drawing of four 3d views of the assembly

projects.name: Modeling and Control of Ball and Beam System
projects.description:
Modeled an implementation of a ball-and-beam system with 14” track using SolidWorks upon which a ball can roll lengthwise with desired equilibrium ball position input fed via Arduino
Computed governing equations using dynamics analysis
Implemented and tuned PID control system within MATLAB Simulink according to minimize response time and overshoot
Plotted theoretical ball position versus time for desired ball position inputs

multimedia.caption: Isometric view of the 3d SOLIDWORKS model of the ball and beam setup. Arduino and wiring connections are omitted for simplicity.
Dimensioned drawing of the side view.
Simulink simulation elements modeling the ball position over time.
Output of the Simulink simulation for 30 second intervals of the ball desired position set to 0, 6, 2, and 11 inches.
Output of the Simulink simulation for 30 second intervals of the ball desired position set to 0, 6, 2, and 11 inches, but exported to the MATLAB plot viewer to find ±2% steady state time values.
Wireframe iso view of the model.

projects.name: BeachWorm Music Recommendation Web App
projects.description:
Developed a responsive web application designed to offer music playback and recommendations based on a like-and-dislike system with features such as playlist creation and customization
Implemented back-end RESTful API using a stack based on the Django Python framework with a SQLite database and front-end with React and Material UI, utilizing the Spotify Web Playback SDK for in-browser persistent song playback across pages
Followed standard software development practices such as creation of wireframes and design documentation across development phases

multimedia.caption: Final demo video submitted as part of the Senior Project capstone showcasing a majority of functionality developed for the application

projects.name: Personal Webpage
projects.description:
You're looking at it! This is a simple webpage written in vanilla HTML, JavaScript ES6, and (S)CSS.
Code for this site is available on my GitHub. All animations performed using pure CSS transitions and JavaScript. Specific resume line items are loaded in via a JSON file that may be hot-swapped at any time just by editing an item.

internships.description:
Created 3d printed models and circuit models for use in lab testing set-up including Altium schematic and PCB designs and SolidWorks models
Developed Simulink simulation elements towards an efficient real-time implementation of a high-lift motor controller system
Produced mechanical drawings for fabrication of aerospace hardware test setup required to resist large vibrational forces according to GD&T (ASME Y14.5) standards

Built RESTful API endpoints on top of the product’s Java + Hibernate back-end stack and associated queries to pull from and store data within the PostgreSQL database
Redesigned and implemented the Java back-end for a service allowing merchants to efficiently import multi-thousand row CSV files of external customer lists into their customer audience
Updated behavior and logic of existing web service features according to new specifications; documented these changes within internal documentation

Designed and implemented the logic for a new part of the clover.com front-end shop experience using a responsive React/Redux-based ES6 framework using TypeScript
Found, analyzed and fixed JIRA-ticketed visual and behavioral bugs within the front-end codebase
Participated in an Agile development environment to streamline production releases

jobs.description:
Instructed and oversaw students in lab classes of up to 30 students to help teach computer science course material concepts
Assisted in sections of Introduction to Object-Oriented Programming and Data Structures & Algorithms and hosted one-on-one online office hours
Provided one-on-one assistance to students as necessary to address lapses in understanding and reinforce good programming practices

Closed store independently at the end of each shift
Counted and balanced registers to ensure accurate accounts
Trained several new employees on standard operating procedures
Prepared food and beverages according to order and consistent with organizational and health standards
